name: NDOC-12574
summary: X221458 - Nokia 7750 TiMOS Upgrade to TiMOS-SR-20.10.R4 - V1.0

info.description:
The Nokia 7750 Service Routers (namely AGW05/06/07/08s/MGW01 & MW02) have been deployed in the RCBIN network as Provider Edge devices to provide EON related services, e.g Ethernet Private Line (EPL), Ethernet Virtual Private Line (EVPL), Rogers Dedicated Internet (RDI), Virtual Private LAN service (VPLS), and Virtual Private Routed Network (VPRN) services.

In order to deliver the new features, we need to upgrade all existing and to be deployed Nokia 7750's from TiMOS-C-16.0.R3-2 to new TiMOS version SR-20.10.R4. New required features are -
 
-	Support for the Nokia SAS SX 64P Satellite

summary: X221353 - Nokia 7210 SAS TiMOS Upgrade to TiMOS-B-20.9.R6 - V1.0

info.description:
The Nokia 7210 SAS Routers (namely 7210 SAS-D, T, SX Stand alone and M) have been deployed in the EON network as Network Interface Devices (NIDs) and Aggregator switchess to provide EON related services, e.g Ethernet Private Line (EPL), Ethernet Virtual Private Line (EVPL), Rogers Dedicated Internet (RDI), Virtual Private LAN service (VPLS), and Virtual Private Routed Network (VPRN) services.

In order to continue the support of these devices after the upgrade of NFMP to version 22.6,  we need to upgrade all existing and to be deployed Nokia 7210 SAS-D, T, SX Stand alone and M's to new TiMOS version TiMOS-B-20.9.R6.

name: NDOC-11147
summary: X220786.01 EON MVPNV4 BGP ADDRESS FAMILY SESSION SEPARATION - V1.0

info.description:
h1. 1.0 Executive Summary

 

This EDS provide guidance and configuration for VPN RR(Route Reflector) peering on BGP *MVPNv4* address family separation from existing BGP peerings. For context, current BGP address families {*}VPNv4{*}, {*}VPNv6{*}, *MVPNv4* are running through a single BGP TCP peering session. A separation will provide added layer of isolation and reduce collatetal damage to services under *VPNv4* and *VPNv6*  address families if instability is presented in *MVPNv4* address family that does not conforms to Nokia support of RFC-7606 error-handling capabilities, in another word if a malformed BGP packet is unrecognizable to be processed properly then a BGP session reset still can occur and the impact will be contained to *MVPNv4* services.

 

In addition, the design change will also be improving configuration for *VPNv4* and *VPNv6* address families. Current BGP session initiation from *EON AGW* nodes are using *SYSTEM IP* address as source toward *VPN RRs* *Loopback0* IP address, while *VPN RRs* are initiating using *Loopback0* towards *EON AGW* *Loopback0 IP* address. This creates asymmetry, though ultimately the session initiated from VPN RRs will remain operational, there would a higher resiliency if session initated through EON AGW nodes can establish session as well, in the off chance that maybe config is made on VPN RR side to only act as passive mode, then session will not form. In addition due to BGP timers, this new design has the potential of reducing network convergence time as now both sides are actively trying to establish session toward each other. One thing to note is that when both sides are initiating the peering, another session will be ceased as part of normal BGP process when one session is established.

name: NDOC-10429
summary: X221270.01- WPN-NUTRIEN vSecGW RAN OAM Connectivity - V1.0

info.description:
1.0 Executive Summary

WPN(Wireless Private Network) is a new product from R4B to provide Mobile EPC(Evolve Packet Core) functions at customer premise. NUTRIEN, a WPN solution customer requires transport of OAM management traffic for the RAN, IPRAN, TLAN and CPE back to RCMIN network for the OSS servers and applications. 

Through repurposing of available virtual Router and Firewall VMs in the VAS Platform, a new logical naming has been provided and will be call vSecGW(Virtual Security Gateway) for the role of terminating IPSec tunnels and routing OAM traffic through SDE security zone TEN/UEN back to RCMIN.

name: NDOC-10418
summary: X221270.01-  WPN-NUTRIEN vSecGW RAN OAM Connectivity  - V1.0

info.description:
WPN(Wireless Private Network) is a new product from R4B to provide Mobile EPC(Evolve Packet Core) functions at customer premise. WPN customer Nutrien requires transport of OAM management traffic for the RAN, IPRAN, TLAN and CPE back to RCMIN network for the OSS servers and applications.

 

Through repurposing of available virtual Router and Firewall VMs in the VAS Platform, a new logical naming has been provided and will be call vSecGW(Virtual Security Gateway) for the role of terminating IPSec tunnels and routing OAM traffic through SDE security zone TEN back to RCMIN.

name: NDOC-8463
summary: X220961.01 NHL Immersiv.io AWS Outpost SDE connectivity - V1.0

info.description:
h1. 1.0  Executive Summary

EON network will be providing L3VPN connectitivy on AGW06.WLFDLE to support Technology Partnerships & Incubation team on NHL Immersiv demo is a showcase of low latency AR application(Immersiv) leveraging AWS Outpost MEC platform and Rogers 5G network. This would be first MEC application deployed on AWS outpost in Rogers network demonstrating the benefits and 5G and MEC.

Demo/POC to occur before Playoff during regular season game and needs urgent connectivity between NHL servers inside Arena to application residing in Rogers network.

name: NDOC-3229
summary: 10G Optics change on Uplinks between MGW01.WRDNONAM and AGW05.HMTPON02 - V1.0

info.description: The purpose of this engineering plan is to swap XFP Optics going from MGW01.WRDNONAM (75 John St. Hamilton) to AGW05.HMTPON02 (499 King St. W, Hamilton). Transport is installing new Appollo Ribbon equipment that is required for the deployment of a new DWDM system in the SWO Region. Existing Lindsay Cube couplers will be leveraged and need the 1550nm wavelength. As a result, the circuits mentioned that are using this wavelength will need to move to the 1590nm wavelength which is available.
